title: South Korea will be vulnerable to North’s drones for years, leak warns
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | An incursion late last year exposed extensive weaknesses and shortcomings in South Korea’s air defense, U.S. intelligence indicates.

title: Here’s how rockets from Gaza test Israel’s Iron Dome
description: Amid spiraling violence sparked by clashes in Jerusalem, a familiar sound has returned to southern Israel: the blare of rocket sirens and the explosions of Iron Dome interceptors.

title: Here’s how rockets from Gaza test Israel’s Iron Dome
description: Amid intensifying tensions, a familiar sound returned to southern Israel: the blare of rocket sirens and the explosions of Iron Dome interceptors.

title: To meet EV demand, industry turns to technology long deemed hazardous
description: Indonesia is richly endowed with nickel, but refining it for electric vehicle batteries poses a daunting environmental challenge.

title: Biden administration mobilizes troops, prepares new asylum restriction
description: As Title 42 border expulsions cease this week, 1,500 more U.S. troops are heading to the southern border in anticipation of a major influx of migrants.

title: David Miranda, Brazilian gay rights activist and legislator, dies at 37
description: He assisted his husband, journalist Glenn Greenwald, in disseminating information from classified U.S. documents leaked by whistleblower Edward Snowden.

title: Why is Eurovision a big deal? A guide for perplexed Americans.
description: The United Kingdom is hosting this year's competition, the biggest, and strangest, live music event on the planet.

title: Gaza militants launch rockets toward Tel Aviv after deadly Israeli strikes
description: The rocket attacks by Gaza militants were the first sign of promised retaliation for Israeli airstrikes that have killed at least 20 people over the last two days.

title: Turkey election: Erdogan’s challenger vows to end ‘authoritarian rule’
description: “Turkey is a country of prohibitions," Kemal Kilicdaroglu told The Post in an interview this week. "When we are in power, Turkey will be a country of freedom.”

title: These women were killed decades ago. Interpol wants help ID’ing them.
description: The international police organization's Operation Identify Me program is focused on 22 women whose killings in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany were never solved.

title: Gunman kills five in attack in Tunisia during Jewish pilgrimage
description: The victims of the attack included two Jewish pilgrims, a 30-year-old Tunisian and a 42-year-old French national.

title: Brits are boasting about ‘having a Chinese.’ U.S. TikTokers are horrified.
description: It's not just chicken balls, fries and curry sauce that turn American stomachs in this TikTok takeout war. Many say the British phrase "having a Chinese" is racist.

title: Pakistani provinces request military support after arrest of Imran Khan
description: Two regions requested military mobilization against Khan supporters, and several protesters were reported killed.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia readying ‘catastrophic’ evacuation of nuclear plant staff, Ukraine says
description: Ukraine's nuclear utility said Russian authorities controlling Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant are preparing to evacuate more than 3,000 staff and families from the facility and surrounding areas.

title: Macron praises courage of French journalist killed by rocket fire in Ukraine
description: Arman Soldin of Agence France-Presse, who covered the conflict from its start, died in Bakhmut. At least 17 journalists have been killed since the war began.

title: Rita Lee's fans and family gather for final goodbye to Brazil's 'Queen of Rock'
description: Thousands of fans have joined Rita Lee Jones’ family at her wake in Sao Paulo to mourn the death of Brazil’s “Queen of Rock”

title: Greek police rescue new group of migrants from border islet
description: Greek police say 17 migrants have been rescued from a tiny islet in the river that runs along Greece’s northeastern land border with Turkey

title: These women were killed decades ago. Interpol wants help ID’ing them.
description: The international police organization's Operation Identify Me program is focused on 22 women whose killings in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany were never solved.

description: The United Kingdom is hosting this year's competition, the biggest, and strangest, live music event on the planet.

title: Brits are boasting about ‘having a Chinese.’ U.S. TikTokers are horrified.
description: It's not just chicken balls, fries and curry sauce that turn American stomachs in this TikTok takeout war. Many say the British phrase "having a Chinese" is racist.

title: Biden’s border plans face a major test as Title 42 restrictions end
description: The Biden administration prepared for the May 11 end of Title 42 migrant restrictions as a looming crisis at the U.S.-Mexico border. How might it play out?

title: French expert in Russian history wins Spanish award
description: Ninety-three-year-old French historian Hélène Carrère d’Encausse, an eminence in Russian and Central Asian history, has won Spain’s Princess of Asturias Award for Social Science for 2023

title: Tributes pour in for AFP journalist killed in Ukraine
description: Colleagues of Arman Soldin, the Agence France-Presse journalist slain Tuesday in Ukraine, have gathered solemnly at the press agency’s Paris headquarters Wednesday to remember him

title: Saudi Arabia invites Syrian president to Arab summit
description: Saudi Arabia has invited Syrian President Bashar Assad to the upcoming Arab League summit in the oil-rich kingdom

title: Italy smashes cross-border migrant smuggling ring
description: Italian police say they have arrested 29 people and smashed a transnational operation that brought migrants illegally into Italy by sea and then smuggled them in vehicles into northern Europe

title: Pakistani provinces request military support after arrest of Imran Khan
description: Two regions requested military mobilization against Khan supporters, and several protesters were reported killed.

title: To lessen border surge, Democrats urge Biden to end Trump’s Venezuela policy
description: The push from within Biden's party comes as the administration expects a large influx of migrants at the southern border once pandemic restrictions expire.

title: Lawmakers pave way for EU to ratify treaty protecting women
description: The European Union has taken a step closer to ratifying a landmark European treaty protecting women from violence

title: Hong Kong amends law to limit foreign lawyers in some cases
description: Hong Kong lawmakers have passed an amendment to a law granting the city’s leader the power to bar overseas lawyers from handling national security cases

title: Germany to allow audio recording of some criminal trials
description: Germany plans to allow sound recording of some criminal trials, ending the decades-long practice of requiring judges, prosecutors and defense lawyers to rely on notes and their memory

title: Toll rises to 5 killed in Tunisia synagogue attack
description: Tunisia’s TAP news agency says the death toll rose to five people killed, including two Jewish pilgrims and three Tunisian police guards, after an attack near a synagogue on the Mediterranean island of Djerba during an annual Jewish pilgrimage

title: Schoolboy in Tokyo stabbed in chest, suspect arrested
description: Japanese police say a schoolboy was stabbed in the chest as he stepped out of his house to go to school in a residential area of downtown Tokyo

title: Russia ends visa regime for Georgia, restores direct flights
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed decrees abolishing visas for Georgian nationals and lifting a 2019 ban on direct flights to the South Caucasus nation

title: Gaza militants launch rocket attacks following more Israeli strikes
description: The rocket attacks by Gaza militants were the first sign of promised retaliation for Israeli airstrikes that have killed more than a dozen people over the last two days.

title: Britain: 1st babies born in country using DNA from 3 people
description: Britain’s fertility regulator says the first babies created using an experimental technique combining DNA from three people have been born, in an effort to prevent the children from inheriting rare genetic diseases

title: Swiss villagers told to evacuate over Alpine rockslide alert
description: Authorities in eastern Switzerland have ordered residents of the tiny village of Brienz to evacuate by Friday evening because geology experts say a mass of 2 million cubic meters of Alpine rock looming overhead could break loose and spill down in coming weeks

title: Catholic, Orthodox Coptic popes offer joint Vatican blessing
description: Pope Francis and the Orthodox Coptic pope have delivered a joint blessing from St. Peter’s Square

title: Biden’s border plans face a major test as Title 42 restrictions end
description: The Biden administration prepared for the May 11 end of Title 42 migrant restrictions as a looming crisis at the U.S.-Mexico border. How might it play out?

title: Thai voters could oust military from power — barring election fraud
description: Polling suggests Thai voters want change after a decade of military rule. But key institutions, from the senate to the election commission, could stand in the way.

title: Teen killed, 9 injured in knife attack in Polish orphanage
description: Authorities in Poland say a 16-year-old girl was killed and nine other people were injured in a knife attack in an orphanage in central Poland

title: To lessen border surge, Democrats urge Biden to end Trump’s Venezuela policy
description: The push from within Biden's party comes as the administration expects a large influx of migrants at the southern border once pandemic restrictions expire.

title: 22 dead women, no names: Interpol seeks clues on cold cases
description: Germany, Belgium and the Netherlands, working with Interpol, have launched an international appeal to help identify 22 women who mostly met violent deaths

title: Report: Car bombing near Syria's Damascus wounds 5 officers
description: Syrian state media say a car bombing close to a police station near the country’s capital of Damascus wounded five officers

title: An Erdogan defeat would mark a victory for liberal democracy worldwide
description: “If [President Recep Tayyip Erdogan] loses power via elections, that will give a lot of people hope that the autocratic surge can be reversed,” Turkish politics expert Gonul Tol said.

title: German chancellor, state officials meet for migration summit
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is holding a summit with top officials of the country’s 16 states over the growing number of asylum-seekers and the lack of housing and spaces in schools or kindergartens for them

title: Ukraine live briefing: Wagner head accuses Russian troops of fleeing Bakhmut; U.S., U.K. pledge continued aid
description: After Vladimir Putin's Victory Day speech, Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky compared his country’s fight against Russia to the battle against Nazism in World War II.

title: South Sudanese flee Sudan's conflict yet return to crisis
description: More than 40,000 people have crossed into South Sudan since neighboring Sudan erupted into conflict nearly one month ago

title: Israel kills 2 Palestinian gunmen in new West Bank violence
description: The Israeli military says troops killed two Palestinian gunmen who fired on them in the occupied West Bank

title: The trials of Prince Harry: 1st phone hacking case to begin
description: Prince Harry’s legal battle against the British press faces its biggest test yet and threatens to do something he said his family long feared: put a royal on the witness stand to discuss embarrassing revelations

title: Macron praises courage of French journalist killed by rocket fire in Ukraine
description: Arman Soldin of Agence-France Presse, who covered the conflict from its start, died in Bakhmut. At least 17 journalists have been killed since the war began.

title: Pakistan braces for turmoil as ex-PM Khan due in court
description: The opposition party of Pakistan’s former Prime Minister Imran Khan has called for demonstrators to remain peaceful

title: Italy begins to reckon with Fascist-era colonial collections
description: Italy is starting to come to terms with its Fascist-era colonial past and the loot it has in its museums

title: Thai voters could oust military from power — barring election fraud
description: Polling suggests Thai voters want change after a decade of military rule. But key institutions, from the senate to the election commission, could stand in the way.

title: Fears over scores of zoo animals caught in Sudan crossfire
description: Dozens of zoo animals in Sudan’s capital are feared dead after street battles between the country’s rival forces made the location unreachable

title: As more women forgo the hijab, Iran's government pushes back
description: More women are choosing not to wear the mandatory headscarf, or the hijab, publicly in Iran

title: Ecuadoran lawmakers put President Lasso on impeachment’s path
description: Guillermo Lasso, accused of embezzlement, denies wrongdoing; a legislative oversight commission has recommended against impeachment.
